page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The majority of people in this area either worked in{farming,}or{commuted to their jobs in Oswestry. In recent decades increased mechanisation on farms has brought about a reduction in the number of labourers employed. At peak periods such as sheep-shearing and harvest part-time labour is sought on farms. Many people worked outside the area. Some were employed in shops and offices in the nearby town of Oswestry. Of several teachers living in the area one taught chemistry in Weston Rhyn at a girls' boarding school. Another had left the profess- ion to become a freelance journalist. A couple living in an isolated cottage had give up their teaching jobs in the south of England and had set up a cabinet_making business at home, selling their products in Oswestry.
